oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.mapred.job

Class BaseJob<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Configured
      • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.mapred.job.BaseJob<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the input keys
    V - the type of the input values
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IndexedInputBaseJob, KMeansClustering, MultipleInputsJob, SpatialIndexing, SuggestService

    public abstract class BaseJob<K,V>
extends Configured
    Defines the basic parameters and validations for vector jobs
    Author:
    hsaucedo

      • getCmdOptionsWithInputDataSets

        public java.lang.String getCmdOptionsWithInputDataSets()
        Gets a descriptive text about the parameters expected by the job plus a description of the supported input data set types
        Returns:
        a string

      • getCurrentCmdArgs

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getCurrentCmdArgs(Configuration conf)
        Returns the current driver properties in a map where each key-value is a name and value of a command line argument. By printing this information it is possible to know how to execute a similar job from command line
        Parameters:
        conf - a job configuration
        Returns:
        a map which entries are of type <String,String> or <String, Map<String, Object>> for multiple input data sets. For nested maps, the entry types are the same than the enclosing map

      • getCurrentCmdArgsAsString

        public java.lang.String getCurrentCmdArgsAsString(Configuration conf)
        Returns the current driver properties as a space-separated list of name=value elements. By printing this information it is possible to know how to execute a similar job from command line
        Parameters:
        conf - a job configuration
        Returns:
        a string containing command line arguments

      • getInput

        public java.lang.String getInput()
        Gets the job input string
        Returns:
        a path, comma-separated paths or a path pattern

        Returns:
